ngiemboon: Tsɔ̌ nyìŋ laa wó, lezíŋ sé gwɔ́ lê Mishÿé, á fóo shÿó mekwɛ́ Efalayîm.
en: There was a man from the hill country of Ephraim named Micah.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, ńgɔɔn né má we ngie: «Nkáb ya pàg ntsáʼ ńzáb pàg nkÿo gie mé la jʉ tà ɔ̀ tyé mvfò mèŋ ńzoon tà ḿbúb la, mèŋ zɔ la pí.» Má we pÿɛ ngie: «Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn! Cʉ̀apʉ̀a néŋ mbʉ́lè na gù.»
en: He said to his mother, “The 1,100 pieces of silver taken from you, and that I heard you place a curse on #— #here’s the silver. I took it.”

ngiemboon: À la gÿo púʼu, ńtsɔ́ʼ nkáb ayɛ̌, ńná né má we, á gɔɔn ngie: «N ge ná nkáb yɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́ mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, à cʉa púʼu, mé lɔ́ɔn tà e cʉ́ʼ ntse, mé lɔg ḿbwóon tútú, ńná né míŋ wɔ̀ɔn.» Mishÿé ye, «áa fʉ̀ʼɔɔn páʼɔɔn mèŋ n ge tsɔ́ʼ nkáb jù ŋwɛ́ ná.»
en: He returned the 1,100 pieces of silver to his mother, and his mother said, “I personally consecrate   the silver to the Lord for my son’s benefit to make a carved image and a silver idol.  # 17:3 Or image and a cast image, also in v. 4 I will give it back to you.”

ngiemboon: À la gɔɔn púʼu, ńtsɔ́ʼ nkáb ŋwɛ́, ńná né má we, á gʉa mǒ ḿbí pàg nkÿo pʉa, ńnáa mbwó tâlɔ̀ɔn. Á leen ńdɔ́ɔn tà é cʉ́ʼ ntse, á lɔg ḿbwóon tútú, mé tÿɔ́gɔ ndá Mishÿé.
en: So he returned the silver to his mother, and she took five pounds of silver and gave it to a silversmith. He made it into a carved image and a silver idol, and it was in Micah’s house.

ngiemboon: Mishÿé lɔgɔ pɛ́ʼɛ̀ ńgẅiin yé jʉʼ gie à guʼte ssé wó. À la gÿo mé vfo nzsǒ nyìŋ gẅie à nuŋe pwɔʼ, ńgíŋe ńgÿo mé nyɛte tsɔ́ púɔ metútú. À la gʉa na gubé yé, ńtsɔ́ʼɔ tàʼ, ńdɔg ńgÿo we nùŋepwɔʼ.
en: This man Micah had a shrine, and he made an ephod and household idols,   and installed one of his sons to be his priest.

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉ̀ʼ ayɛ̌, epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ té fùɔ gẅiin: wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ gÿo pɔ́ yé mmó gie à kwǒŋ.
en: In those days there was no king in Israel;   everyone did whatever seemed right to him.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ múɔshùm laa wó, ńgwɔ́ na ngẅɛ̀ Lěvî, ńtsẅé Mbɛ́tèlehɛm. Mbɛ́tèlehɛm gwɔ́ tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ na ngẅɛ̀ ye Yúndà.
en: There was a young man, a Levite from Bethlehem in Judah, who was staying within the clan of Judah.

ngiemboon: À la fó Mbɛ́tèlehɛm, ńgʉa léfaʼa tsɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ gie à ge cʉ́ʼʉ néŋe pɔ́ wó. À la nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mánzsè ne ńgee, ńcʉa mbʉ̀a Mishÿé, á na pàga láʼa mekwɛ́ Efalayîm.
en: The man left the town of Bethlehem in Judah to stay wherever he could find a place. On his way he came to Micah’s home in the hill country of Ephraim.

ngiemboon: Mishÿé zɛ́te yé ngie: «Ɔ̀ fóo nzsǒ?» Á tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «N gee nyìŋ na ngẅɛ̀ Lěvî, mèŋ n kɔ́ɔn ńtsẅé Mbɛ́tèlehɛm na ngẅɛ̀ ye Yúndà, n ne faʼa jʉʼ gie n ge cʉ́ʼʉ ńnéŋe pɔ́ wó.»
en: “Where do you come from? ” Micah asked him.

ngiemboon: Mishÿé gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Pɔ̀gɔ zɔ cʉ́ʼʉ ńtsẅé, gwɔ́ mbwó mèŋ, ńgwɔ́ páʼ tá wɔ̀ɔn, ńgwɔ́ páʼ nùŋepwɔʼ we tsìŋendá yɔ́ɔn. N ge tsɔ́ʼɔ fàʼ jú né nkáb pàg legém na ngùʼu láʼ; é ná menzsǒ né gù pɔ́ sẅɛ̀ɛ sẅɛ̀ɛ, mbɔɔ shúm léjÿó.» À la júʼ, ńkúu ndá;
en: Micah replied,   “Stay with me and be my father  # 17:10 Gn 45:8; Jdg 18:19; Jr 3:19 and priest, and I will give you four ounces of silver a year, along with your clothing and provisions.” So the Levite went in

ngiemboon: ḿbiŋ ńzẅíŋe légwɔ́ gie pɔ́ ye ge tsẅé. À la piŋ ńdíe múɔshùm awɛ̌ pɔ́ páʼ tsɔ̌ míŋ we la.
en: and agreed to stay with the man, and the young man became like one of his sons.

ngiemboon: Mishÿé leen ńké, ńnáa fàʼ né yé, ńdɔgɔ yé ńgÿo nùŋepwɔʼ we. Á cʉʼʉ ńtsẅé pɔ́ mbʉ̀a yé.
en: Micah consecrated the Levite, and the young man became his priest   and lived in Micah’s house.

ngiemboon: Mishÿé gɔɔn ngie: «Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, n zsě ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ge gÿo nò mbòŋo na mèŋ, á nue n gẅǐin nyìŋ na ngẅɛ̀te Lěvî páʼ wɔ̀ɔn nùŋepwɔʼ.»
en: Then Micah said, “Now I know that the Lord will be good to me, because a Levite has become my priest.”
